page.title: 17St. Martin's Church 1.
page.content: St. Martin's church is over l,OOO years old. The church was already standing in lO42 according to old records. The governor used to live in the Parish of St. Martin which is why it was considered the leading church in the Island. The architecture of the church shows that it was built in several stages. Half of the south wall is rough boulders and the other half is quarried stone and the two halves of the roof are slightly different in height. The church has grown from a tiny chapel to what it is today. First a nave was added to the chancel, then about a century later, a south aisle. The spire was not built until l582. It was struck by lightning and shattered in l6l6 and again in l837. Later it was rebuilt with a lightning conductor.
